alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following area, Cook. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Automated rain gauges indicate between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell in the past hour as thunderstorms moved overhead. Rainfall rates will continue to decrease over the next hour. However, ponding on roadways, low-lying areas, and rises in streams and creeks will continue for the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Hammond, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Calumet City, Chicago Heights, Roseland, Burbank, Lansing, Oak Forest, Harvey, Homer Glen, Blue Island, Dolton, Homewood, Alsip, Palos Hills, Hinsdale and Lemont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
